page.title: 13Education in Taverham
page.content: (contd from page 12) but about 50 go home and the rest bring a packed meal. There are 38 classrooms and the average size of a class is 25 pupils.{School uniform}is compulsory for the High School pupils but not compulsory but encouraged for the Primary school children of Ringland and Taverham. {Taverham Hall Prep. School} is a private school with pupils aged from 4 to 13. There are 78 day children and 116 boarders. There are 18 staff and class sizes are about 14. The children have a busy day, getting up at 7.35 and having lessons until 5.30 when they have tea with a short break at 11.00 and a longer one for lunch at 12.30. The fees are Â£1180 per term and the uniform is compulsory. The pupils go on to other fee-paying public schools all over England at age >12.
